ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned to speak Italian better. L3 was pretty much an in-depth review of L1, but definitely helped solidify the grammar and vocab.
Practiced more functional italian for conversation and writing and covered a few new grammatical tenses.
I learned more Italian and got to practice my speaking a lot more.
This class really developed my reading skills in Italian.
Solidifying Italian grammar knowledge and more focus on speaking and writing.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: More talking in Italian and less writing would be helpful. While writing is important, the ability to communicate in Italian is the only skill I will use long term. We do so much writing / activities for homework, making sure that we are discussing for almost the entirety of the class would be helpful.
the inconsistency with the way this course was taught and administered was detrimental to learning and receiving good grades
This course is interesting and the assignments are helpful to learning the material, however, the grading was always a little unclear and thus lead to confusion and disorganization in the assigments.
I enjoyed the grammar and talking activities. It could be improved by incorporating more grammar into class lectures.
I really liked the asynchronous day on Friday that added much more flexibility to my schedule.
Nice instructors but disorganized and the final was really hard. There is a lot of assessments but overall good language to take.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: At this point, you are taking L3 Italian because you took L1 and L2. Compared to L1 and L2, L3 is easier in my opinion. I don't know if this was because of my teacher or the material, but don't worry about your third semester of Italian!
no - at least not with this prof

If you are completing your language requirement, this is a good course to take. However, there is very little clarity about how well you can do in the course, and thus it can be stressful and a lot of work.
Yes. I ended up loving Italian.
Good to fulfill language requirement, not a gut language though, you will have to learn and do some work.
